German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

Middle High German geswister, from Old High German giswestar. Compare Schwester (“sister”).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ɡəˈʃvɪstɐ/
  • Audio
    		(file)
  • Hyphenation: Ge‧schwis‧ter
  • Rhymes: -ɪstɐ

Noun[edit]

Geschwister n (genitive Geschwisters, plural Geschwister, diminutive Geschwisterchen n)

  1. sibling

Usage notes[edit]

  • Uncommon in the singular.

Declension[edit]

Declension of Geschwister
singularplural
indef.def.noundef.noun
nominativeeindasGeschwisterdieGeschwister
genitiveeinesdesGeschwistersderGeschwister
dativeeinemdemGeschwisterdenGeschwistern
accusativeeindasGeschwisterdieGeschwister

Derived terms[edit]

  • Geschwisterkind
